title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 December 2013 - XWiki

10:04 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <tekzilla> has quit  
10:13 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> good morning  
10:19 <vmassol> I hope everyone is ready to release 5.3 today!  
10:19 <vmassol> since we're already late in our lateness :)  
10:20 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <mflorea> vmassol: CI looks good for 5.3.x branch  
10:22 <vmassol> good  
10:22 <mflorea> [all] don't commit on stable-5.3.x branch  
10:22 <mflorea> vmassol: there are two issues left on solr for 5.3: one I can't really fix, I'll explain in a comment, and one which is vague, I'll comment also on jira  
10:23 <vmassol> ok I think it's acceptable to move them to 5.4 or 5.3.1  
10:23 <vmassol> (you could get the agreement from the reporter)  
10:24 <jbernard\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <Kaisen> Hello every body  
10:27 <Kaisen> I have two small questions  
10:28 <Kaisen> What is the best way to get help if I face problems with a extension  
10:28 <Kaisen> Use Jira or a comment on the extension itself?  
10:28 <Kaisen> or ask you over irc  
10:31 <vmassol> good question  
10:31 <vmassol> email I think would be best  
10:31 <vmassol> and if it's urgent and you need a discussion IRC but the extension developer may not be here  
10:31 <vmassol> at last resort comment on the extension page  
10:31 <Kaisen> OK so I will email them :)  
10:31 <vmassol> and jira if the project has a jira (they don't all have one)  
10:32 <cjd> perhaps using the users mailing list? a lot of extension developers are subscribed there and others might already know the fix  
10:32 <vmassol> no  
10:32 <vmassol> sorry I meant list by email  
10:32 <vmassol> no direct email  
10:32 <vmassol> :)  
10:33 <Kaisen> ok  
10:33 <Kaisen> On other stupid question. What is the biggest Xwiki installation you know  
10:33 <vmassol> biggest in what?  
10:33 <vmassol> users?  
10:33 <vmassol> number of pages?  
10:33 <Kaisen> Pages & Attachements  
10:33 <vmassol> not sure, I know curriki.org  
10:34 <Kaisen> and my be users  
10:34 <vmassol> 9,259,169 Unique Visitors 381,468 Members 54,046 Resources 764 Groups  
10:34 <cjd> I think the XWiki SAS Intranet has something like a 30GB database.. if that's at all helpful.. I highly doubt it's the largest though  
10:34 <vmassol> you could contact XWiki SAS and ask them  
10:35 <vmassol> (see http://xwiki.com)  
10:35 <Kaisen> =O  
10:36 <Kaisen> Ok in this way I can give our users the possibility to upload a lot of attachments  
10:36 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <Kaisen> Yes i changed that at the beginning  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> Hi guys  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> I have discovered a bug  
10:37 <gdelhumeau> XWIKI-9789  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> I can provide a quick fix because it looks like a regression  
10:38 <cjd> Kaisen: don't worry about attachments then, setup a ZFS pool if you need to store >1TB and let your users upload  
10:39 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you need to get agreeement from mflorea  
10:39 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <jigar\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <Jigar54> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <jigar\_\_> has quit  
11:02 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I'm fine providing it isn't too dangerous  
11:03 <mflorea> let me read the description  
11:03 <msmeria> has quit  
11:05 <Kaisen> @cjd What did you mean with ZFS pool. I just change the Attachment Storage to file system in xwiki.cfg like discribed in the wiki page Attachments  
11:06 <cjd> ZFS is a filesystem, completely seperate from XWiki  
11:06 <cjd> it's good at handling very very large amounts of data and high loads  
11:06 <cjd> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZFS  
11:08 <UCC> has quit  
11:08 <Kaisen> Oh thanks for the link.  
11:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <Kaisen> I created a exta LVM for the /var and put there also the file storage  
11:10 <Kaisen> It all runs in a virtual machine. So if I need to expand the /var I just added a other vmdk to the LVM to increase the file space.  
11:11 <cjd> Sounds good  
11:12 <cjd> Something to keep in mind is if there are multiple versions of an attachment, each is stored in a seperate file rather than using binary diff/patch  
11:12 <cjd> for most workloads this makes sense but if you were doing something like video editing where you had very large files and made lots of small changes to them, you might want to back it by a filesystem which has deduplication  
11:13 <Kaisen> As the VMDK is stored on a SAN with deduplication it should work in anyway  
11:13 <Kaisen> Is just the question how efficent it will be  
11:13 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: make a pull request and depending on the complexity of the fix we'll decide  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: ok, I'm doing it  
11:14 <mflorea> the limitation is indeed important  
11:14 <cjd> most of the time, the files which change often are small (eg a spreadsheet) and diffing them would introduce it's own performance concerns  
11:23 <j-simard> has quit  
11:25 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <Jigar54> has quit  
11:54 <gdelhumeau> PR to apply on 5.3 too  
11:57 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: comment  
12:00 <DarkKnightCZ> how to get xwiki instance and xwiki context in component? i need to work with several documents and attachments in my component, but injecting XWiki fails  
12:01 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ:  
12:01 <tmortagne> @Inject  
12:02 <tmortagne> (and you get the XWiki instance from the XWikiContext)  
12:03 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: answered  
12:04 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: and back ;)  
12:05 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: nice, thanks  
12:06 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: OK, I have reverted this part  
12:13 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: applied  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> thx  
12:14 <gdelhumeau> I have closed the jira and put a comment http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9789  
12:16 <Denis> has quit  
12:23 <Jigar54> has joined #xwiki  
12:33 <jbernard\_> Hello everybody ! I have an issue when i want to install XWiki Livetable Excel Export Macro : "Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.extension.handler.ExtensionHandler] hint = [plugin]]"  
12:34 <jbernard\_> This is display on the extention manager, as error message.  
12:34 <jbernard\_> Have you an idea ?  
12:36 <tmortagne> jbernard\_: see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LiveTableExcelExport+Macro#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions  
12:37 <tmortagne> this extension depends on excel plugin which is not supported by extension manager  
12:42 <jbernard\_> Thanks, it was that !  
12:52 <camil7> tmortagne: nice find about the confluence export and its CDATA sections :D  
12:53 <camil7> it seems in some cases the patching up of the broken CDATA comes too late, however; it already breaks the import before the ConfluenceXHTMLParser sees it  
12:55 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
13:00 <camil7> it seems this needs to be fixed in the ConfluenceXMLPackage reader, too ... well, I am just evaluating what is really going on, but might send a pull request later on if that is the problem. however it seems I have to duplicate a bit of code :(  
13:07 <camil7> ah, no, just forget it, it is probably a feature needed to nest CDATA sections ...  
13:18 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <jbernard\_> has quit  
13:46 <Denis> has quit  
13:48 <jbernard\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <jbernard\_> has quit  
13:51 <tmortagne> camil7: ok, don't hesitate to create jira issue when you see something wrong in confluence parser  
13:52 <tmortagne> things already known: I need to work on a configuration to tell confluence how convert one macro into another, right now you ends up with the exact same macro than in the confluence content which does not work for most of them  
13:52 <camil7> yes, ok, will do so. It seems the kludge with the CDATA is for nesting CDATA (improperly) ... and the regexp to repair it does not work if the text contains a ']' ... trying to unit test this, however  
13:53 <camil7> ah, and macros, ok, yes, I will need to look into that; thanks for letting me know about the current limitation  
13:54 <tmortagne> currently finishing a big refactoring of EM XAR handler and will get back on confluence importer  
14:02 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <andreeapopescu> Hello devs! Can anyone move the XPoll's component to a stand alone Jira project?  
14:03 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: ok, creating a jira project for you  
14:03 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: this is for this extension right: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Polls+Application ?  
14:04 <andreeapopescu> no, for this one http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XPoll  
14:04 <vmassol> ok, is there an exixsting component for it in jira?  
14:05 <andreeapopescu> yes http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCONTRIB/component/13240  
14:05 <j-simard\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <j-simard> has quit  
14:08 <vmassol> can you find the release dates for 1.0 and 1.1 for me please  
14:08 <vmassol> (andreeapopescu)  
14:08 <jtafurth|away> is now known as <jtafurth>  
14:09 <andreeapopescu> for 1.0 -  2012/07/13  
14:09 <andreeapopescu> for 1.1 - 2012/12/11  
14:09 <vmassol> thanks  
14:11 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: done  
14:11 <andreeapopescu> vmassol: thank you  
14:12 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XPOLL  
14:44 <j-simard\_> has quit  
14:45 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <sburjan> has quit  
14:57 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <maxr\_> has left #xwiki  
15:05 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <tmortagne> camil7: if you have a package to reproduce XRENDERING-324 that would be super cool, will look at it today or tomorrow (not sure tomorrow is going to be very productive)  
15:16 <camil7> yes, I am looking into it  
15:17 <camil7> actually I try to look at it right now, and hope to send a pull request  
15:17 <tmortagne> ok even better :)  
15:17 <camil7> the rendering unit tests are not my friends ATM, but I am working on it ;)  
15:18 <tmortagne> tel me if you have question about rendering test framework  
15:20 <camil7> the "expect" part has only "event/1.0" as block renderer hooked up? This event drops the confluence macros which contain the broken CDATA  
15:22 <tmortagne> you could use xdom+xml/current instead to have something a bit more precise I guess  
15:22 <tmortagne> it's a XML representation of the exact rendering events  
15:24 <camil7> ah, ok thanks, trying ....  
15:24 <jtafurth> is now known as <jtafurth|away>  
15:27 <lucaa> has quit  
15:31 <tmortagne> the only think with xdom+xml is that it's not formated by default so it's not super nice to read the result  
15:35 <camil7> yes, I noticed about the formatting :)  ... but it also drops confluence macros (these <ac:structured-macro ac:name="code"> ) from the input, and that is where the evil CDATA are actually hidden  
15:35 <camil7> well, I am fiddeling anyway ...  
15:36 <tmortagne> camil7: if you don't have it in the xdom+xml i means the parse did not send it  
15:36 <tmortagne> s/parse/parser/  
15:37 <camil7> ah, ok, come to think of thats actually the bug I want to test for, so no wonder it is mising :)  ... should try to update the code first and see if its in there  
15:47 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <Kaisen> has quit  
16:00 <vmassol> andreeapopescu: "XWiki Simple Poll Application - Doodle like" You may drop "XWiki" since everything is about XWiki  
16:01 <andreeapopescu> the description is in pom.xml and I already made a release  
16:01 <vmassol> for next time  
16:01 <andreeapopescu> yes  
16:01 <vmassol> you can fix it now and it'll appear next time  
16:02 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, does anyone have an idea what could cause "com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException Error number 3301 in 3: Exception while switching to database" when deleting attachment from document? (in component, version 5.1, using document.deleteAttachment() )  
16:10 <andreeapopescu> has left #xwiki  
16:27 <Jigar54> has left #xwiki  
16:29 <vrachieru> has quit  
16:38 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
16:42 <lucaa> hello guys  
16:42 <lucaa> I am about to fix this issue http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9798  
16:43 <lucaa> do you think it would make sense to put it on the 5.3 branch as well?  
16:43 <vmassol> lucaa: nope  
16:43 <vmassol> could go in 5.3.1  
16:43 <vmassol> IMO  
16:43 <vmassol> now mflorea is the RM  
16:44 <vmassol> (he's releasing 5.3 now I believe)  
16:44 <mflorea> lucaa: for 5.3.1, but not for 5.3, so please don't commit on stable-5.3.x now, I'm going to start the release  
16:45 <lucaa> oh, when i meant 5.3 branch I meant for 5.3.1, I had 5.3 was released already  
16:45 <lucaa> ok  
16:45 <lucaa> \* I thought 5.3 was released  
16:45 <lucaa> ok then, I will commit it on master and wait for the release to be ready to merge it for 5.3.`  
16:45 <lucaa> 5.3.1  
16:51 <lucaa> can somebody create version 5.3.1 for me?  
16:51 <lucaa> on jira  
16:51 <lucaa> ?  
16:52 <mflorea> a sec  
16:52 <lucaa> so that I can set my fix version to 5.3.1 as well?  
16:52 <lucaa> or it doesn't work like that?  
16:52 <lucaa> thanks mflorea  
16:52 <mflorea> platform right?  
16:52 <lucaa> yes  
16:53 <mflorea> done  
16:54 <mflorea> vmassol: I'd like to delete 4.5.5 ad 5.1.1? I doubt we will release then.  
16:55 <vmassol> ok for me  
16:55 <vmassol> you're doing jenkins too?  
16:55 <mflorea> I can do it yes  
16:55 <vmassol> ok  
16:55 <mflorea> what does "Archive" mean?  
16:55 <vmassol> you've used my script before?  
16:56 <vmassol> "archive"? where?  
16:56 <mflorea> only for creating  
16:56 <vmassol> ok it's another script  
16:56 <mflorea> in jira, in the menu that has Release  
16:56 <mflorea> I'll find the script  
16:56 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/scriptler/runScript?id=remove-jobs.groovy  
16:57 <vmassol> you need to run it first and if the output is ok then uncomment the code that does the remove and run again  
16:57 <vmassol> it's a safety :)  
16:57 <mflorea> if I remove 4.5.5, then we'll lose the information that some issues were fixed in 4.5.x branch  
16:57 <vmassol> yes  
16:57 <mflorea> we have the commit tag, but still  
16:57 <mflorea> s/tag/tab  
16:57 <vmassol> not a problem if we don't want to release 4.5.x  
16:57 <mflorea> I don't think we want  
16:58 <vmassol> agree  
16:58 <mflorea> I'll proceed  
17:04 <evalica> has quit  
17:06 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:08 <tmortagne> we will probably delete the branch anyway too  
17:08 <vmassol> actually I thought that's what marius was proposing to do too :)  
17:08 <mflorea> no, just de jira version and ci jobs  
17:08 <vmassol> it's in line with our practice  
17:09 <mflorea> for now  
17:09 <mflorea> we can remove the branch when we move to 6.0  
17:09 <vmassol> in that case same applies for jira  
17:09 <vmassol> for me they go together  
17:10 <mflorea> too late for jira  
17:11 <vmassol> it's a discrepancy otherwise  
17:11 <vmassol> we already have components  
17:11 <mflorea> we have for EM only  
17:11 <mflorea> DW is part of EM  
17:11 <vmassol> yes  
17:11 <vmassol> that's why we have one  
17:11 <mflorea> yes, but she wants to see only DW related issues  
17:12 <mflorea> a subcategory if you want  
17:12 <vmassol> then why have EM label?  
17:12 <vmassol> and why do you need to see just DW  
17:12 <vmassol> there's a reason theu're put together  
17:12 <vmassol> it's because its the same domain  
17:12 <vmassol> otherwise we would put them in different places in xwiki-platform  
17:13 <vmassol> (which we can do if we consider they're not the same domain but I'm not sure about that)  
17:13 <mflorea> the only reason would be for EM related issues that are outside platform, in XE for instance  
17:13 <vmassol> Ithere's no EM issue in XE  
17:13 <vmassol> only in platform  
17:13 <vmassol> if you find issues about EM in enterprise then they need to be moved to platform  
17:14 <mflorea> we have DW issues in XE though  
17:14 <vmassol> that's wrong  
17:14 <mflorea> nlpe  
17:14 <mflorea> nope  
17:14 <vmassol> they need to be moved to platform  
17:14 <mflorea> nope  
17:14 <mflorea> they are just about packaging  
17:14 <vmassol> then they're not about DW  
17:14 <mflorea> e.g. a missing old alias in a pom  
17:14 <vmassol> they're about packaging  
17:14 <vmassol> we have a package category  
17:14 <vmassol> category = component  
17:14 <mflorea> they are related to DW, from a user POV  
17:15 <mflorea> they break DW  
17:15 <vmassol> I see, I still think it's a very bad idea  
17:15 <vmassol> to have labels  
17:15 <mflorea> I'm not talking about category, I'm talking about "related" issues  
17:15 <vmassol> because nobody will maintain them  
17:15 <vmassol> anyway  
17:15 <mflorea> I agree we shouldn't add laves for anything  
17:16 <mflorea> I don't think the EM label is needed  
17:16 <mflorea> DW could be useful  
17:16 <evalica> has quit  
17:16 <mflorea> may a "personal labels" feature in jira would be useful, so that evalica can add her labels without modifying the issues  
17:17 <mflorea> basically what she wants is to be able to display the list of DW-relates issues using a single query  
17:18 <mflorea> and these issues can be spread in multiple projects and sometimes even categories  
17:18 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:18 <mflorea> you can have any topic instead of DW, like uix  
17:19 <MatthiasWegner> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <vmassol> uix is better because it's transversal and we have no other way to express it  
17:19 <vmassol> in any case what she's doing is only going to work right now  
17:19 <vmassol> it'll be broken tomorrow  
17:20 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <vmassol> so it's something temporary  
17:20 <vmassol> we don't need a jira view of DW-related issue  
17:20 <vmassol> (that works all the time)  
17:20 <vmassol> but yes no private labels in jira unfortunately  
17:21 <vmassol> but it's easy to create a filter with specific issues listed  
17:21 <vmassol> a private filter  
17:21 <mflorea> ok  
17:21 <vmassol> ok no big deal  
17:22 <vmassol> it's a pity it's sending emails too ;)  
17:22 <vmassol> there are 40 or 50 issues concerning EM for ex  
17:23 <vmassol> so that's 40 or 50 emails....  
17:23 <vmassol> unless  
17:23 <vmassol> unless caty uses a search and then do a bulk edit  
17:23 <vmassol> and then unchecks the box that says "send email"  
17:25 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: ping  
17:25 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: pong  
17:27 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: I am not sure, but I might have found a bug. I have migrated a wiki from 4.5.3 to 5.2.2 and I have lost my Wiki Index link. Also the top menu looks as a regular XE. Nothig to see my other subwikis, except the Wiki Manager Application. Any clue what I have missed ?  
17:28 <sburjan> actually Wiki Manager does not appear in the Application Panel
